accounts

Class Statistics

  • java.lang.Object
    • accounts.Statistics

  • public class Statistics
extends java.lang.Object
    Statistics keep track of the battle records of all users.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ze

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addNewUser(User user)
      add a new user to the statsArray with the corresponding 0's
      static Statistics getInstance()
      The getter for singleton design, it makes sure that there is only one instance of this object.
      User[] getTopTen()
      This method gets the top ten players (with the highest number of wins) as a list of User.
      void readStatsFile()
      Read stats.csv to prepare for stats inquiries.
      void readVersusFromFile(User user1, User user2)
      Read from stats.csv for versus records, and update the user objects' corresponding fields.
      void updateStats(User user1, User user2)
      Update the statsArray, where all the info is still temporarily stored in memory.
      void updateStatsFile()
      Write the stats info in memory to the file.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Statistics getInstance()
        The getter for singleton design, it makes sure that there is only one instance of this object.
        Returns:
        return the only instance of the Statistics object

      • readStatsFile

        public void readStatsFile()
        Read stats.csv to prepare for stats inquiries.

      • updateStatsFile

        public void updateStatsFile()
        Write the stats info in memory to the file.

      • readVersusFromFile

        public void readVersusFromFile(User user1,
                      User user2)
        Read from stats.csv for versus records, and update the user objects' corresponding fields.
        Parameters:
        user1 - Takes in an User object which corresponds to user1.
        user2 - Takes in an User object which corresponds to user2.

      • updateStats

        public void updateStats(User user1,
               User user2)
        Update the statsArray, where all the info is still temporarily stored in memory. This method extracts the versus records from the User objects and update them in the statsArray.
        Parameters:
        user1 - Takes in an User object which corresponds to user1.
        user2 - Takes in an User object which corresponds to user2.

      • addNewUser

        public void addNewUser(User user)
        add a new user to the statsArray with the corresponding 0's
        Parameters:
        user - Takes in an User object which corresponds to the new user.

      • getTopTen

        public User[] getTopTen()
        This method gets the top ten players (with the highest number of wins) as a list of User.
        Returns:
        This method returns an array of size ten, which contains the top ten players.
